summary.long: Matthew is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham became the father of Isaac, and Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob became the father of Judah and his brothers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Judah became the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar, and Perez became the father of Hezron, and Hezron became the father of Aram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aram became the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab became the father of Nahshon, and Nahshon became the father of Salmon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Salmon became the father of Boaz by Rahab, and Boaz became the father of Obed by Ruth, and Obed became the father of Jesse,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and Jesse became the father of David the king.
And David became the father of Solomon by the wife of Uriah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Solomon became the father of Rehoboam, and Rehoboam became the father of Abijah, and Abijah became the father of Asa,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Asa became the father of Jehoshaphat, and Jehoshaphat became the father of Joram, and Joram became the father of Uzziah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Uzziah became the father of Jotham, and Jotham became the father of Ahaz, and Ahaz became the father of Hezekiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Hezekiah became the father of Manasseh, and Manasseh became the father of Amon, and Amon became the father of Josiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Josiah became the father of Jechoniah and his brothers, at the time of the deportation to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the deportation to Babylon, Jechoniah became the father of Shealtiel, and Shealtiel became the father of Zerubbabel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Zerubbabel became the father of Abiud, and Abiud became the father of Eliakim, and Eliakim became the father of Azor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Azor became the father of Zadok, and Zadok became the father of Achim, and Achim became the father of Eliud,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Eliud became the father of Eleazar, and Eleazar became the father of Matthan, and Matthan became the father of Jacob,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jacob became the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary by whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations, and from David to the deportation to Babylon are fourteen generations, and from the deportation to Babylon to the Christ are fourteen generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ occurred in this way. His mother Mary had been betrothed to Joseph, but before they came together, she was found to be pregnant by the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph her husband, being righteous and not wanting to disgrace her, intended to divorce her secretly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as he was considering these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, “Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife, for what has been conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she will give birth to a son, and you will call his name ‘Jesus,’ because he will save his people from their sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all this happened in order that what was spoken by the Lord through the prophet would be fulfilled, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, the virgin will become pregnant and will give birth to a son,
and they will call his name Emmanuel,”
which is translated, “God with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph, when he woke up from sleep, did as the angel of the Lord commanded him, and he took his wife
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and did not have sexual relations with her until she gave birth to a son. And he called his name Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod the king, behold, wise men from the east came to Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Where is the one who has been born king of the Jews? For we have seen his star at its rising and have come to worship him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when King Herod heard it, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and after calling together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he inquired from them where the Christ was to be born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said to him, “In Bethlehem of Judea, for thus it is written by the prophet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘And you, Bethlehem, land of Judah,
    are by no means least among the rulers of Judah,
for from you will go out a ruler
    who will shepherd my people Israel.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod secretly summoned the wise men and determined precisely from them the time when the star appeared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent them to Bethlehem and said, “Go, inquire carefully concerning the child, and when you have found him, report to me so that I also may come and worship him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they listened to the king, they went out, and behold, the star which they had seen at its rising led them until it came and stood above the place where the child was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they saw the star, they rejoiced with very great joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came into the house, they saw the child with Mary his mother, and they fell down and worshiped him. And opening their treasure boxes, they offered him gifts of gold and frankincense and myrrh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And being warned in a dream not to return to Herod, they went back to their own country by another route.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after they had gone away, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph, saying, “Get up, take the child and his mother and flee to Egypt, and stay there until I tell you. For Herod is about to seek the child to destroy him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he got up and took the child and his mother during the night and went away to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he was there until the death of Herod, in order that what was said by the Lord through the prophet would be fulfilled, saying,
“Out of Egypt I called my son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod, when he saw that he had been deceived by the wise men, became very angry, and he sent soldiers and executed all the children in Bethlehem and in all the region around it from the age of two years old and under, according to the time which he had determined precisely from the wise men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then what was spoken by the prophet Jeremiah was fulfilled, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A voice was heard in Ramah,
    weeping and great mourning,
Rachel weeping for her children,
    and she did not want to be comforted,
because they exist no longer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after Herod had died, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Get up, take the child and his mother and go to the land of Israel, for those who were seeking the life of the child are dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he got up and took the child and his mother and entered the land of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there, and being warned in a dream, he took refuge in the regions of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came and lived in a town called Nazareth, in order that what was said by the prophets would be fulfilled: “He will be called a Nazarene.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in those days John the Baptist came preaching in the Judean wilderness
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven has come near!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is the one who was spoken about by the prophet Isaiah, saying,
“The voice of one crying out in the wilderness,
‘Prepare the way of the Lord,
    make his paths straight.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now John himself had his clothing made from camel’s hair and a belt made of leather around his waist, and his food was locusts and wild honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jerusalem and all Judea and all the district around the Jordan were going out to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were being baptized by him in the Jordan River as they confessed their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism, he said to them, “Offspring of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore produce fruit worthy of repentance!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And do not think to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as father.’ For I say to you that God is able to raise up children for Abraham from these stones!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Already now the ax is positioned at the root of the trees; therefore every tree not producing good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I baptize you with water for repentance, but the one who comes after me is more powerful than I am, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His winnowing shovel is in his hand, and he will clean out his threshing floor and will gather his wheat into the storehouse, but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to John in order to be baptized by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But John tried to prevent him, saying, “I need to be baptized by you, and do you come to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered and said to him, “Permit it now, for in this way it is right for us to fulfill all righteousness.” Then he permitted him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now after he was baptized, Jesus immediately went up from the water, and behold, the heavens opened and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove coming upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a voice from heaven saying, “This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus was led up into the wilderness by the Spirit to be tempted by the devil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and after he had fasted forty days and forty nights, then he was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the tempter approached and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, order that these stones become bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said, “It is written, ‘Man will not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes out of the mouth of God.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil took him to the holy city and placed him on the highest point of the temple
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down! For it is written,
‘He will command his angels concerning you,’
and
‘On their hands they will lift you up,
lest you strike your foot against a stone.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “On the other hand it is written, ‘You are not to put the Lord your God to the test.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Again the devil took him to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to him, “I will give to you all these things, if you will fall down and worship me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Go away, Satan, for it is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God and serve only him.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil left him, and behold, angels came and began ministering to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he heard that John had been arrested, he withdrew into Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And leaving Nazareth, he went and lived in Capernaum by the sea, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order that what was spoken by the prophet Isaiah would be fulfilled, who said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Land of Zebulun and land of Naphtali,
toward the sea, on the other side of the Jordan,
    Galilee of the Gentiles—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the people who sit in darkness
    have seen a great light,
and the ones who sit in the land and shadow of death,
    a light has dawned on them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time on, Jesus began to preach and to say, “Repent, because the kingdom of heaven is near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as he was walking beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon called Peter and his brother Andrew, throwing a casting net into the sea (for they were fishermen).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Follow me and I will make you fishers of people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately they left their nets and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And going on from there, he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee and his brother John, in the boat with their father Zebedee, mending their nets, and he called them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately they left the boat and their father and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went around through all of Galilee, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the good news of the kingdom and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a report about him went out throughout Syria, and they brought to him all those who were sick with various diseases and afflicted by torments, demon-possessed and epileptics and paralytics, and he healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And large crowds followed him from Galilee, Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and from the other side of the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he saw the crowds, he went up the mountain and after he sat down, his disciples approached him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And opening his mouth he began to teach them, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blessed are the poor in spirit,
    because theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are the ones who mourn,
    because they will be comforted.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are the meek,
    because they will inherit the earth.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are the ones who hunger and thirst for righteousness,
    because they will be satisfied.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are the merciful,
    because they will be shown mercy.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are the pure in heart,
    because they will see God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are the peacemakers,
    because they will be called sons of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are those who are persecuted because of righteousness,
    because theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are you
    when they insult you and persecute you and say all kinds of evil things against you, lying on account of me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Rejoice and be glad, because your reward is great in heaven, for in the same way they persecuted the prophets before you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You are the salt of the earth. But if salt becomes tasteless, by what will it be made salty? It is good for nothing any longer except to be thrown outside and trampled under foot by people.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You are the light of the world. A city located on top of a hill cannot be hidden,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: nor do they light a lamp and place it under a basket, but on a lampstand, and it shines on all those in the house.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: In the same way let your light shine before people, so that they can see your good works and glorify your Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Do not think that I have come to destroy the law or the prophets. I have not come to destroy them but to fulfill them.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For truly I say to you, until heaven and earth pass away, not one tiny letter or one stroke of a letter will pass away from the law until all takes place.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore whoever abolishes one of the least of these commandments and teaches people to do so will be called least in the kingdom of heaven, but whoever keeps them and teaches them, this person will be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For I say to you that unless your righteousness greatly surpasses that of the scribes and Pharisees, you will never enter into the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said to the people of old, ‘Do not commit murder,’ and ‘whoever commits murder will be subject to judgment.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say to you that everyone who is angry at his brother will be subject to judgment, and whoever says to his brother, ‘Stupid fool!’ will be subject to the council, and whoever says, ‘Obstinate fool!’ will be subject to fiery hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore if you present your gift at the altar and there remember that your brother has something against you,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: leave your gift there before the altar and first go be reconciled to your brother, and then come and present your gift.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Settle the case quickly with your accuser while you are with him on the way, lest your accuser hand you over to the judge, and the judge to the officer, and you be thrown into prison.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Truly I say to you, you will never come out of there until you have paid back the last penny!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘Do not commit adultery.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say to you that everyone who looks at a woman to lust for her has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if your right eye causes you to sin, tear it out and throw it from you! For it is better for you that one of your members be destroyed than your whole body be thrown into hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if your right hand causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it from you! For it is better for you that one of your limbs be destroyed than your whole body go into hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “And it was said, ‘Whoever divorces his wife must give her a certificate of divorce.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say to you that everyone who divorces his wife, except for a matter of sexual immorality, causes her to commit adultery, and whoever marries a divorced woman commits adultery.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Again you have heard that it was said to the people of old, ‘Do not swear falsely, but fulfill your oaths to the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say to you, do not swear at all, either by heaven, because it is the throne of God,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: or by the earth, because it is the footstool of his feet, or by Jerusalem, because it is the city of the great king.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And do not swear by your head, because you are not able to make one hair white or black.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But let your statement be ‘Yes, yes; no, no,’ and anything beyond these is from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say to you, do not resist the evildoer, but whoever strikes you on the right cheek, turn the other to him also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the one who wants to go to court with you and take your tunic, let him have your outer garment also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whoever forces you to go one mile, go with him two.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give to the one who asks you, and do not turn away from the one who wants to borrow from you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘Love your neighbor’ and ‘Hate your enemy.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say to you, love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: in order that you may be sons of your Father who is in heaven, because he causes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and he sends rain on the just and the unjust.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Do not the tax collectors also do the same?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if you greet only your brothers, what are you doing that is remarkable? Do not the Gentiles also do the same?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore you be perfect as your heavenly Father is perfect.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “And take care not to practice your righteousness before people to be seen by them; otherwise you have no reward from your Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore whenever you practice charitable giving, do not sound a trumpet in front of you, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, in order that they may be praised by people. Truly I say to you, they have received their reward in full!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But you, when you practice charitable giving, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: in order that your charitable giving may be in secret, and your Father who sees in secret will reward you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whenever you pray, do not be like the hypocrites, because they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and on the corners of the streets, in order that they may be seen by people. Truly I say to you, they have received their reward in full!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But whenever you pray, enter into your inner room and shut your door and pray to your Father who is in secret, and your Father who sees in secret will reward you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “But when you pray, do not babble repetitiously like the pagans, for they think that because of their many words they will be heard.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore do not be like them, for your Father knows what you need before you ask him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Therefore you pray in this way:
“Our Father who is in heaven,
may your name be treated as holy.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
May your kingdom come,
may your will be done
    on earth as it is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give us today our daily bread,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
and forgive us our debts,
    as we also have forgiven our debtors.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
And do not bring us into temptation,
but deliver us from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For if you forgive people their sins, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if you do not forgive people, neither will your Father forgive your sins.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Whenever you fast, do not be sullen like the hypocrites, for they make their faces unrecognizable in order that they may be seen fasting by people. Truly I say to you, they have received their reward in full!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when you are fasting, put olive oil on your head and wash your face
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: so that you will not be seen by people as fasting, but to your Father who is in secret, and your Father who sees in secret will reward you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and consuming insect destroy and where thieves break in and steal,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but store up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor consuming insect destroy and where thieves do not break in or steal.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “The eye is the lamp of the body. Therefore if your eye is sincere, your whole body will be full of light.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if your eye is evil, your whole body will be dark. Therefore if the light in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “No one is able to serve two masters. For either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to one and despise the other. You are not able to serve God and money.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “For this reason I say to you, do not be anxious for your life, what you will eat, and not for your body, what you will wear. Is your life not more than food and your body more than clothing?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Consider the birds of the sky, that they do not sow or reap or gather produce into barns, and your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not worth more than they are?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And who among you, by being anxious, is able to add one hour to his life span?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And why are you anxious about clothing? Observe the lilies of the field, how they grow: they do not toil or spin,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but I say to you that not even Solomon in all his glory was dressed like one of these.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if God dresses the grass of the field in this way, although it is here today and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, will he not do so much more for you, you of little faith?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore do not be anxious, saying, ‘What will we eat?’ or ‘What will we drink?’ or ‘What will we wear?,’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: for the pagans seek after all these things. For your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But seek first his kingdom and righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore do not be anxious for tomorrow, because tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Do not judge, so that you will not be judged.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For by what judgment you judge, you will be judged, and by what measure you measure out, it will be measured out to you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And why do you see the speck that is in your brother’s eye, but do not notice the beam of wood in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or how will you say to your brother, ‘Allow me to remove the speck from your eye,’ and behold, the beam of wood is in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Hypocrite! First remove the beam of wood from your own eye and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother’s eye!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Do not give what is holy to dogs, or throw your pearls in front of pigs, lest they trample them with their feet, and turn around and tear you to pieces.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and it will be opened for you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For everyone who asks receives, and the one who seeks finds, and to the one who knocks it will be opened.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or what man is there among you, if his son will ask him for bread, will give him a stone?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or also if he will ask for a fish, will give him a snake?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore if you, although you are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask him?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore in all things, whatever you want that people should do to you, thus also you do to them. For this is the law and the prophets.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Enter through the narrow gate, because broad is the gate and spacious is the road that leads to destruction, and there are many who enter through it,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: because narrow is the gate and constricted is the road that leads to life, and there are few who find it!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Beware of false prophets who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inside are ravenous wolves.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You will recognize them by their fruits: they do not gather grapes from thorn bushes or figs from thistles, do they?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: In the same way, every good tree produces good fruit, but a bad tree produces bad fruit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: A good tree is not able to produce bad fruit, nor a bad tree to produce good fruit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Every tree that does not produce good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: As a result, you will recognize them by their fruits.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter into the kingdom of heaven, but the one who does the will of my Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: On that day many will say to me, ‘Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy in your name, and expel demons in your name, and perform many miracles in your name?’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And then I will say to them plainly, ‘I never knew you. Depart from me, you who practice lawlessness!’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Therefore everyone who hears these words of mine and does them will be like a wise man who built his house on the rock.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the rain came down and the rivers came and the winds blew and beat against that house, and it did not collapse, because its foundation was laid on the rock.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And everyone who hears these words of mine and does not do them will be like a foolish man who built his house on the sand.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the rain came down and the rivers came and the winds blew and beat against that house, and it collapsed, and its fall was great.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And it happened when Jesus finished these words the crowds were amazed at his teaching,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he was teaching them like one who had authority, and not like their scribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came down from the mountain, large crowds followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a leper approached and worshiped him, saying, “Lord, if you are willing, you are able to make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And extending his hand he touched him, saying, “I am willing, be clean.” And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “See that you tell no one, but go, show yourself to the priest and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now when he entered Capernaum, a centurion approached him, appealing to him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “Lord, my slave is lying paralyzed in my house, terribly tormented!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “I will come and heal him.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the centurion answered and said, “Lord, I am not worthy that you should come in under my roof. But only say the word and my slave will be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I also am a man under authority who has soldiers under me, and I say to this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes, and to another one, ‘Come!’ and he comes, and to my slave, ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus heard this, he was astonished, and said to those who were following him, “Truly I say to you, I have found such great faith with no one in Israel.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say to you that many will come from east and west and be seated at the banquet with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the sons of the kingdom will be thrown out into the outer darkness. In that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And Jesus said to the centurion, “Go, as you have believed it will be done for you.” And the slave was healed at that hour.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when Jesus came into Peter’s house, he saw his mother-in-law lying down and suffering with a fever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he touched her hand and the fever left her, and she got up and began to serve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when it was evening, they brought to him many who were demon-possessed, and he expelled the spirits with a word. And he healed all those who were sick,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in order that what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah would be fulfilled, who said,
“He himself took away our sicknesses,
and carried away our diseases.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus saw many crowds around him, he gave orders to depart to the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a scribe approached and said to him, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Foxes have dens and birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And another of the disciples said to him, “Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Follow me, and leave the dead to bury their own dead!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And as he got into the boat, his disciples followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a great storm arose on the sea, so that the boat was being inundated by the waves, but he himself was asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came and woke him, saying, “Lord, save us! We are perishing!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Why are you fearful, you of little faith?” Then he got up and rebuked the winds and the sea and there was a great calm.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the men were astonished, saying, “What sort of man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came to the other side, to the region of the Gadarenes, two demon-possessed men coming from among the tombs met him, very violent, so that no one was able to pass by along that road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, they cried out, saying, “What do you have to do with us, Son of God? Have you come here to torment us before the time?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a long way from them a large herd of pigs was feeding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the demons implored him, saying, “If you are going to expel us, send us into the herd of pigs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Go!” So they departed and went into the pigs, and behold, the whole herd rushed headlong down the steep slope into the sea and drowned in the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the herdsmen fled and went into the town and reported everything, including the things concerning the demon-possessed men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, the whole town came out to meet Jesus, and when they saw him, they implored him that he would depart from their region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And getting into a boat, he crossed over and came to his own town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, they brought to him a paralytic lying on a stretcher, and when Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, “Have courage, child, your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And behold, some of the scribes said to themselves, “This man is blaspheming!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And knowing their thoughts, Jesus said, “Why do you think evil in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For which is easier to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But in order that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,” then he said to the paralytic, “Get up, pick up your stretcher and go to your home.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he got up and went to his home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the crowds saw this, they were afraid and glorified God who had given such authority to men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Jesus was going away from there, he saw a man called Matthew sitting at the tax booth and said to him, “Follow me!” And he stood up and followed him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And it happened as he was dining in the house, behold, many tax collectors and sinners were coming and dining with Jesus and his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they saw it, the Pharisees began to say to his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he heard it, he said, “Those who are healthy do not have need of a physician, but those who are sick.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But go and learn what it means, “I want mercy and not sacrifice.” For I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the disciples of John approached him, saying, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples do not fast?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “The bridegroom’s attendants are not able to mourn as long as the bridegroom is with them. But days are coming when the bridegroom is taken away from them, and then they will fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But no one puts a patch of unshrunken cloth on an old garment, for its patch pulls away from the garment, and the tear becomes worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor do they put new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise the wineskins burst and the wine is spilled, and the wineskins are destroyed. But they put new wine into new wineskins and both are preserved.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: As he was saying these things to them, behold, one of the rulers came and knelt down before him, saying, “My daughter has just now died, but come, place your hand on her and she will live!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus and his disciples got up and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a woman who had been suffering with a hemorrhage twelve years approached from behind and touched the edge of his cloak,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for she said to herself, “If only I touch his cloak I will be healed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, turning around and seeing her, said, “Have courage, daughter! Your faith has healed you.” And the woman was healed from that hour.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when Jesus came into the ruler’s house and saw the flute players and the disorderly crowd,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he said, “Go away, because the girl is not dead, but is sleeping.” And they ridiculed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the crowd had been sent out, he entered and took her hand, and the girl got up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this report went out into that whole region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Jesus was going away from there, two blind men followed him, crying out and saying, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came into the house, the blind men approached him, and Jesus said to them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?” They said to him, “Yes, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then he touched their eyes, saying, “According to your faith let it be done for you.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And their eyes were opened, and Jesus sternly warned them, saying, “See that no one finds out.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But they went out and spread the report about him in that whole region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as they were going away, behold, they brought to him a demon-possessed man who was unable to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the demon had been expelled, the one who had been mute spoke, and the crowds were astonished, saying, “This has never been seen before in Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees were saying, “By the ruler of demons he expels the demons!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus was going around all the towns and the villages, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the good news of the kingdom and healing every disease and every sickness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw the crowds, he had compassion for them, because they were weary and dejected, like sheep that did not have a shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to his disciples, “The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore ask the Lord of the harvest that he send out workers into his harvest.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And summoning his twelve disciples, he gave them authority over unclean spirits, so that they could expel them and could heal every disease and every sickness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the names of the twelve apostles: first Simon who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip, and Bartholomew, Thomas, and Matthew the tax collector, James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon the Zealot, and Judas Iscariot—the one who also betrayed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sent out these twelve, instructing them saying, “Do not go on the road to the Gentiles, and do not enter into a city of the Samaritans,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but go instead to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And as you are going, preach, saying, ‘The kingdom of heaven has come near!’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Heal those who are sick, raise the dead, cleanse lepers, expel demons. Freely you have received; freely give.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Do not procure gold or silver or copper for your belts.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Do not take a traveler’s bag for the road, or two tunics, or sandals, or a staff, for the worker is deserving of his provisions.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And into whatever town or village you enter, inquire who in it is worthy, and stay there until you depart.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when you enter into the house, greet it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if the house is worthy, let your peace come upon it, but if it is not worthy, let your peace return to you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whoever does not welcome you or listen to your words, shake off the dust from your feet as you are going out of that house or that town.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Truly I say to you, it will be more bearable for the region of Sodom and Gomorrah on the day of judgment than for that town!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Behold, I am sending you out like sheep in the midst of wolves. Therefore be wise as serpents and innocent as doves.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But beware of people, because they will hand you over to councils, and they will flog you in their synagogues.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And you will be brought before both governors and kings because of me, for a witness to them and to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But whenever they hand you over, do not be anxious how to speak or what you should say, for what you should say will be given to you at that hour.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For you are not the ones who are speaking, but the Spirit of your Father who is speaking through you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “And brother will hand over brother to death, and a father his children, and children will rise up against parents and have them put to death,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and you will be hated by everyone because of my name. But the one who endures to the end—this one will be saved.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whenever they persecute you in this town, flee to another, for truly I say to you, you will never finish going through the towns of Israel until the Son of Man comes.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “A disciple is not superior to his teacher, nor a slave superior to his master.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: It is enough for the disciple that he become like his teacher, and the slave like his master. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebul, how much more the members of his household?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Therefore do not be afraid of them, because nothing is hidden that will not be revealed, and nothing secret that will not become known.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: What I say to you in the dark, tell in the light, and what you hear in your ear, proclaim on the housetops.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And do not be afraid of those who kill the body but are not able to kill the soul, but instead be afraid of the one who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Are not two sparrows sold for a penny? And one of them will not fall to the ground without the knowledge and consent of your Father.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And even the hairs of your head are all numbered!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore do not be afraid; you are worth more than many sparrows.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Therefore everyone who acknowledges me before people, I also will acknowledge him before my Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But whoever denies me before people, I also will deny him before my Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Do not think that I have come to bring peace on the earth! I have not come to bring peace, but a sword.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For I have come to turn a man against his father, and a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the enemies of a man will be the members of his household.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one who loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me, and the one who loves son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whoever does not take up his cross and follow me is not worthy of me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one who finds his life will lose it, and the one who loses his life because of me will find it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “The one who receives you receives me, and the one who receives me receives the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet’s reward, and the one who receives a righteous person in the name of a righteous person will receive a righteous person’s reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whoever gives one of these little ones only a cup of cold water to drink in the name of a disciple, truly I say to you, he will never lose his reward.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And it happened that when Jesus had finished giving orders to his twelve disciples, he went on from there to teach and to preach in their towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when John heard in prison the deeds of Christ, he sent word by his disciples
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, “Are you the one who is to come, or should we look for another?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to them, “Go and tell John what you hear and see:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the blind receive sight and the lame walk, lepers are cleansed and the deaf hear, and the dead are raised, and the poor have good news announced to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever is not offended by me is blessed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as these were going away, Jesus began to speak to the crowds concerning John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what did you go out to see? A man dressed in soft clothing? Behold, those who wear soft clothing are in the houses of kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But why did you go out? To see a prophet? Yes, I tell you, and even more than a prophet!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is this man about whom it is written:
‘Behold, I am sending my messenger before your face,
    who will prepare your way before you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, among those born of women there has not arisen one greater than John the Baptist. But the one who is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from the days of John the Baptist until now, the kingdom of heaven is treated violently, and the violent claim it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if you are willing to accept it, he is Elijah, the one who is going to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who has ears, let him hear!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But to what shall I compare this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplaces who call out to one another,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Behold, a man who is a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ But wisdom is vindicated by her deeds.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began to reproach the towns in which the majority of his miracles had been done, because they did not repent:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless I tell you, it will be more bearable for Tyre and for Sidon on the day of judgment than for you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Capernaum, will you be exalted to heaven? No, you will be brought down to Hades! For if the miracles done in you had been done in Sodom, it would have remained until today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless I tell you that it will be more bearable for the region of Sodom on the day of judgment than for you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus answered and said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the wise and intelligent, and have revealed them to young children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, Father, for to do so was your gracious will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things have been handed over to me by my Father, and no one knows the Son except the Father, and no one knows the Father except the Son and anyone to whom the Son wants to reveal him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come to me, all of you who labor and are burdened, and I will give you rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take my yoke on you and learn from me, for I am gentle and humble in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my yoke is easy to carry and my burden is light.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus went through the grain fields on the Sabbath. And his disciples were hungry, and they began to pluck off heads of grain and eat them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Pharisees saw it, they said to him, “Behold, your disciples are doing what it is not permitted to do on the Sabbath!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to them, “Have you not read what David did when he was hungry, and those with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how he entered into the house of God and ate the bread of the presentation, which it was not permitted for him or for those with him to eat, but only for the priests?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or have you not read in the law that on the Sabbath the priests in the temple violate the sanctity of the Sabbath and are guiltless?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you that something greater than the temple is here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you had known what it means, ‘I want mercy and not sacrifice,’ you would not have condemned the guiltless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And going on from there he came into their synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a man who had a withered hand, and they asked him, saying, “Is it permitted to heal on the Sabbath?” in order that they could accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “What man will there be among you who will have one sheep and if this one fell into a pit on the Sabbath, will not take hold of it and lift it out?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then to what degree is a man worth more than a sheep? So then, it is permitted to do good on the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand,” and he stretched it out, and it was restored as healthy as the other one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees went out and plotted against him in order that they could destroy him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus, when he learned of it, withdrew from there, and many followed him, and he healed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he warned them that they should not reveal his identity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order that what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah would be fulfilled, who said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold my servant whom I have chosen,
    my beloved in whom my soul is well pleased.
I will put my Spirit on him,
    and he will proclaim justice to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not quarrel or cry out,
    nor will anyone hear his voice in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A crushed reed he will not break,
    and a smoldering wick he will not extinguish,
until he brings justice to victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in his name the Gentiles will hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a demon-possessed man who was blind and mute was brought to him. And he healed him so that the man who was mute could speak and see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the crowds were amazed and began saying, “Perhaps this one is the Son of David!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees, when they heard it, said, “This man does not expel demons except by Beelzebul the ruler of demons!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But knowing their thoughts, he said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is laid waste, and every city or household divided against itself will not stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if Satan expels Satan, he is divided against himself. How then will his kingdom stand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I expel demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your sons expel them? For this reason they will be your judges!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I expel demons by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God has come upon you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or how can someone enter into the house of a strong man and steal his property, unless he first ties up the strong man? And then he can thoroughly plunder his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who is not with me is against me, and the one who does not gather with me scatters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason I tell you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven people, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man, it will be forgiven him. But whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven him either in this age or in the coming one!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Either make the tree good and its fruit is good, or make the tree bad and its fruit is bad, for the tree is known by its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Offspring of vipers! How are you able to say good things when you are evil? For from the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The good person from his good treasury brings out good things, and the evil person from his evil treasury brings out evil things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you that every worthless word that they speak, people will give an account for it on the day of judgment!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by your words you will be vindicated, and by your words you will be condemned.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the scribes and Pharisees answered him saying, “Teacher, we want to see a sign from you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said to them, “An evil and adulterous generation desires a sign, and no sign will be given to it except the sign of the prophet Jonah!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as Jonah was in the belly of the huge fish three days and three nights, so the Son of Man will be in the heart of the earth three days and three nights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because they repented at the proclamation of Jonah, and behold, something greater than Jonah is here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The queen of the south will rise up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and behold, something greater than Solomon is here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now whenever an unclean spirit has gone out of a person, it travels through waterless places searching for rest, and does not find it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came out.’ And when it arrives it finds the house unoccupied and swept and put in order.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it goes and brings along with itself seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they go in and live there. And the last state of that person becomes worse than the first. So it will be for this evil generation also!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while he was still speaking to the crowds, behold, his mother and brothers were standing there outside, desiring to speak to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And someone told him, “Behold, your mother and your brothers are standing there outside desiring to speak to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said to the one who told him, “Who is my mother, and who are my brothers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And stretching out his hand toward his disciples, he said, “Behold my mother and my brothers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever does the will of my Father who is in heaven, he is my brother and sister and mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day Jesus went out of the house and was sitting by the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And large crowds gathered close around him, so that he got into a boat to sit down, and all the crowd was standing on the shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spoke many things to them in parables, saying, “Behold, the sower went out to sow,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and while he was sowing, some seed fell on the side of the path, and the birds came and devoured it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And other seed fell on the rocky ground, where it did not have much soil, and it sprang up at once because it did not have any depth of soil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the sun rose it was scorched, and because it did not have enough root, it withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And other seed fell among the thorn plants, and the thorn plants came up and choked it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But other seed fell on the good soil and produced grain, this one a hundred times as much and this one sixty and this one thirty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who has ears, let him hear!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples came up and said to him, “Why do you speak to them in parables?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said to them, “To you it has been granted to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to those people it has not been granted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever has, to him more will be given, and he will have an abundance. But whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason I speak to them in parables, because seeing they do not see, and hearing they do not hear, nor do they understand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and with reference to them the prophecy of Isaiah is fulfilled that says,
“You will listen carefully and will never understand,
    and you will look closely and will never perceive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the heart of this people has become dull,
    and with their ears they hear with difficulty,
    and they have shut their eyes,
so that they would not see with their eyes
    and hear with their ears
    and understand with their heart
    and turn, and I would heal them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But your eyes are blessed because they see, and your ears because they hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For truly I say to you that many prophets and righteous people longed to see what you see, and did not see it, and to hear what you hear, and did not hear it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You, therefore, listen to the parable of the sower:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When anyone hears the word about the kingdom and does not understand it, the evil one comes and snatches away what was sown in his heart. This is what was sown on the side of the path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what was sown on the rocky ground—this is the one who hears the word and immediately receives it with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he does not have a root in himself, but lasts only a little while, and when affliction or persecution happens because of the word, immediately he falls away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what was sown into the thorn plants—this is the one who hears the word, and the anxiety of this world and the deceitfulness of wealth choke the word and it becomes unproductive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what was sown on the good soil—this is the one who hears the word and understands it, who indeed bears fruit and produces, this one a hundred times as much, and this one sixty, and this one thirty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put before them another parable, saying, “The kingdom of heaven may be compared to a man who sowed good seed in his field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while his people were sleeping, his enemy came and sowed darnel in the midst of the wheat and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the wheat sprouted and yielded grain, then the darnel appeared also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the slaves of the master of the house came and said to him, ‘Master, did you not sow good seed in your field? How then does it have darnel?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, ‘An enemy has done this!’ So the slaves said to him, ‘Then do you want us to go and gather them?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “No, lest when you gather the darnel you uproot the wheat together with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let both grow together until the harvest, and at the season of the harvest I will tell the reapers, “First gather the darnel and tie it into bundles to burn them, but gather the wheat into my storehouse.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put before them another parable, saying, “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed that a man took and sowed in his field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is the smallest of all the seeds, but when it is grown it is larger than the garden herbs and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the sky come and nest in its branches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them another parable: “The kingdom of heaven is like yeast that a woman took and put into three measures of wheat flour until the whole batch was leavened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus spoke all these things to the crowds in parables, and he was saying nothing to them without a parable,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Then he left the crowds and came into the house, and his disciples came to him saying, “Explain the parable of the darnel in the field to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he answered and said, “The one who sows the good seed is the Son of Man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the field is the world. And the good seed—these are the sons of the kingdom, but the darnel are the sons of the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the enemy who sowed them is the devil, and the harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus just as the darnel is gathered and burned with fire, so it will be at the end of the age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man will send out his angels and they will gather out of his kingdom all the causes of sin and those who do lawless deeds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and throw them into the fiery furnace. In that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the righteous will shine like the sun in the kingdom of their Father. The one who has ears, let him hear!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The kingdom of heaven is like treasure hidden in a field, that a man found and concealed, and in his joy he goes and sells everything that he has and buys that field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant searching for fine pearls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he found one very valuable pearl, he went and sold everything that he possessed and purchased it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a dragnet that was thrown into the sea and gathered fish of every kind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which when it was filled they pulled to shore and sat down and collected the good fish into containers, but the bad they threw out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus it will be at the end of the age. The angels will go out and separate the evil from among the righteous
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and throw them into the fiery furnace. In that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Have you understood all these things?” They said to him, “Yes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “For this reason every scribe who has been trained for the kingdom of heaven is like the master of the house who brings out of his storeroom new things and old things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that when Jesus had finished these parables he went away from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came to his hometown and began to teach them in their synagogue, so that they were amazed and said, “From where did this man get this wisdom and these miracles?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not this one the son of the carpenter? Is not his mother called Mary and his brothers James and Joseph and Simon and Judas?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And are not all his sisters with us? From where then did this man get all these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were offended by him. But Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his own hometown and in his own household.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he did not perform many miracles in that place because of their unbelief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard the report about Jesus
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to his servants, “This is John the Baptist! He has been raised from the dead, and for this reason miraculous powers are at work in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Herod, after arresting John, bound him and put him in prison on account of Herodias, the wife of his brother Philip,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because John had been saying to him, “It is not permitted for you to have her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And although he wanted to kill him, he feared the crowd, because they looked upon him as a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Herod’s birthday celebration took place, the daughter of Herodias danced in the midst of them and pleased Herod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he promised with an oath to give her whatever she asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And coached by her mother, she said, “Give me the head of John the Baptist here on a platter!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And although the king was distressed, because of his oaths and his dinner guests he commanded the request to be granted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent orders and had John beheaded in the prison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, and she brought it to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his disciples came and took away the corpse and buried it, and went and told Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus heard it, he withdrew from there in a boat to an isolated place by himself. And when the crowds heard it, they followed him by land from the towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he got out, he saw the large crowd and had compassion on them and healed their sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when it was evening, the disciples came to him saying, “The place is desolate and the hour is late. Release the crowds so that they can go away into the villages and purchase food for themselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to them, “They do not need to go away. You give them something to eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, “We do not have anything here except five loaves and two fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “Bring them here to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he commanded the crowds to recline for a meal on the grass. Taking the five loaves and the two fish and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks. And after breaking them, he gave the loaves to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they all ate and were satisfied, and they picked up what was left over of the broken pieces, twelve baskets full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who ate were about five thousand men, in addition to women and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately he made the disciples get into the boat and go ahead of him to the other side, while he sent away the crowds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he sent away the crowds, he went up on the mountain by himself to pray. So when evening came, he was there alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the boat was already many stadia distant from the land, being beaten by the waves, because the wind was against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the fourth watch of the night he came to them, walking on the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the disciples, when they saw him walking on the sea, were terrified, saying, “It is a ghost!” and they cried out in fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But immediately Jesus spoke to them, saying, “Have courage, I am he! Do not be afraid!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter answered him and said, “Lord, if it is you, command me to come to you on the water!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “Come!” And getting out of the boat, Peter walked on the water and came toward Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he saw the strong wind, he was afraid. And beginning to sink, he cried out, saying, “Lord, save me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately Jesus extended his hand and caught him and said to him, “You of little faith! Why did you doubt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they got into the boat, the wind abated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So those in the boat worshiped him, saying, “Truly you are the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the men of that place recognized him, they sent word into that whole surrounding region, and they brought to him all those who were sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were imploring him that they might only touch the edge of his cloak, and all those who touched it were cured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharisees and scribes came to Jesus from Jerusalem, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do your disciples break the tradition of the elders? For they do not wash their hands when they eat a meal.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he answered and said to them, “Why do you also break the commandment of God because of your tradition?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God said, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and ‘The one who speaks evil of father or mother must certainly die.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you say, ‘Whoever says to his father or his mother, “Whatever benefit you would have received from me is a gift to God,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: need not honor his father,’ and you make void the word of God for the sake of your tradition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hypocrites! Isaiah correctly prophesied about you saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘This people honors me with their lips,
    but their heart is far, far away from me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and they worship me in vain,
    teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And summoning the crowd, he said to them, “Hear and understand:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not what goes into the mouth that defiles a person, but what comes out of the mouth—this defiles a person.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples came and said to him, “Do you know that the Pharisees were offended when they heard this saying?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said, “Every plant that my heavenly Father did not plant will be uprooted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them! They are blind guides of the blind. And if the blind guide the blind, both will fall into a pit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter answered and said to him, “Explain this parable to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “Are you also still without understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not understand that everything that enters into the mouth goes into the stomach and is evacuated into the latrine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the things that come out of the mouth come from the heart, and these defile the person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For from the heart come evil plans, murder, adultery, sexual immorality, theft, false witness, abusive speech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the things that defile a person. But eating with unwashed hands does not defile a person!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And departing from there, Jesus went away to the region of Tyre and Sidon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a Canaanite woman from that district came and cried out, saying, “Have mercy on me, Lord, Son of David! My daughter is severely possessed by a demon!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he did not answer her a word. And his disciples came up and asked him, saying, “Send her away, because she is crying out after us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said, “I was not sent except to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she came and knelt down before him, saying, “Lord, help me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said, “It is not right to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she said, “Yes, Lord, for even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their master’s table.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
