verses.text: Then Jesus answered and said to her, “O woman, your faith is great! Let it be done for you as you want.” And her daughter was healed from that hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And departing from there, Jesus went along the Sea of Galilee, and he went up on the mountain and was sitting there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And large crowds came to him, having with them the mute, blind, lame, crippled, and many others, and they put them down at his feet, and he healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then the crowd was astonished when they saw the mute speaking, the crippled healthy, and the lame walking, and the blind seeing, and they praised the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus summoned his disciples and said, “I have compassion on the crowd, because they have remained with me three days already and do not have anything to eat, and I do not want to send them away hungry lest they give out on the way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples said to him, “Where in this desolate place can we get so much bread that such a great crowd could be satisfied?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “How many loaves do you have?” So they said, “Seven, and a few little fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And commanding the crowd to recline for a meal on the ground,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he took the seven loaves and the fish and after he had given thanks, he broke them and began giving them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they all ate and were satisfied, and they picked up what was left over of the broken pieces, seven baskets full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who ate were four thousand men, in addition to women and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he sent away the crowds, he got into the boat and went to the region of Magadan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Pharisees and Sadducees came to test him, they asked him to show them a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he answered and said to them, “When evening comes you say, ‘It will be fair weather because the sky is red,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and early in the morning, ‘Today it will be stormy weather, because the sky is red and darkening.’ You know how to evaluate correctly the appearance of the sky, but you are not able to evaluate the signs of the times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An evil and adulterous generation seeks for a sign, and a sign will not be given to it except the sign of Jonah!” And he left them and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the disciples arrived at the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “Watch out for and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they were discussing this among themselves, saying, “It is because we did not take bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But knowing this, Jesus said, “Why are you discussing among yourselves that you did not take bread, you of little faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not yet understand or do you not remember the five loaves for the five thousand, and how many baskets you took up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or the seven loaves for the four thousand and how many baskets you took up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How do you not understand that I did not speak to you about bread? But beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they understood that he did not say to beware of the leaven of bread, but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus came to the region of Caesarea Philippi, he began asking his disciples, saying, “Who do people say that the Son of Man is?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, Some say John the Baptist, but others Elijah, and others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simon Peter answered and said, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to him, “Blessed are you, Simon son of Jonah, because flesh and blood did not reveal this to you, but my Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I also say to you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my church, and the gates of Hades will not overpower it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven, and whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you release on earth will be released in heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he commanded the disciples that they should tell no one that he was the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time on Jesus began to show his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things from the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised on the third day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him, saying, God forbid, Lord! This will never happen to you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he turned around and said to Peter, “Get behind me, Satan! You are a cause for stumbling to me, because you are not intent on the things of God, but the things of people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to his disciples, “If anyone wants to come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life on account of me will find it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what will a person be benefited if he gains the whole world but forfeits his life? Or what will a person give in exchange for his life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man is going to come in the glory of his Father with his angels, and at that time he will reward each one according to what he has done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, that there are some of those standing here who will never experience death until they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after six days Jesus took along Peter and James and John his brother, and led them up on a high mountain by themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was transfigured before them, and his face shone like the sun, and his clothing became bright as the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, Moses and Elijah appeared to them, talking with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter answered and said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good that we are here! If you want, I will make here three shelters, one for you and one for Moses and one for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them, and behold, a voice from the cloud said, “This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased. Listen to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the disciples heard this, they fell down on their faces and were extremely frightened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus came and touched them and said, “Get up and do not be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they lifted up their eyes they saw no one except him—Jesus alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were coming down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them saying, “Tell no one the vision until the Son of Man is raised from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples asked him, saying, “Then why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said, “Elijah indeed is coming, and will restore all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say to you that Elijah has already come, and they did not recognize him, but did with him whatever they wanted. In the same way also the Son of Man is going to suffer at their hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples understood that he had spoken to them about John the Baptist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came to the crowd, a man approached him, kneeling down before him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “Lord, have mercy on my son, because he has seizures and suffers severely, for often he falls into the fire and often into the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I brought him to your disciples, and they were not able to heal him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said, “O unbelieving and perverse generation! How long will I be with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring him here to me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus rebuked him, and the demon came out of him and the boy was healed from that hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples approached Jesus privately and said, Why were we not able to expel it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Because of your little faith. For truly I say to you, if you have faith like a mustard seed, you will say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move, and nothing will be impossible for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as they were gathering in Galilee, Jesus said to them, “The Son of Man is going to be betrayed into the hands of men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they will kill him, and on the third day he will be raised.” And they were extremely distressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they arrived in Capernaum, the ones who collected the double drachma tax came up to Peter and said, “Does your teacher not pay the double drachma tax?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Yes.” And when he came into the house, Jesus spoke to him first, saying, “What do you think, Simon? From whom do the kings of the earth collect tolls or taxes—from their own sons, or from foreigners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he said, “From foreigners,” Jesus said to him, “Then the sons are free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But so that we do not give offense to them, go out to the sea, cast a line with a hook, and take the first fish that comes up. And when you open its mouth, you will find a four-drachma coin. Take that and give it to them for me and you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the disciples came up to Jesus, saying, “Who then is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And calling a child to himself, he had him stand in their midst
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Truly I say to you, unless you turn around and become like young children, you will never enter into the kingdom of heaven!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore whoever humbles himself like this child, this person is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whoever welcomes one child such as this in my name welcomes me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in me to sin, it would be better for him that a large millstone be hung on his neck and he be drowned in the depths of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to the world because of causes for stumbling, for it is a necessity that causes for stumbling come; nevertheless, woe to the person through whom the cause for stumbling comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if your hand or your foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it from you! It is better for you to enter into life crippled or lame than, having two hands or two feet, to be thrown into the eternal fire!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if your eye causes you to sin, tear it out and throw it from you! It is better for you to enter into life one-eyed than, having two eyes, to be thrown into fiery hell!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See to it that you do not despise one of these little ones, for I tell you that their angels in heaven constantly see the face of my Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What do you think? If a certain man has a hundred sheep, and one of them wanders away, will he not leave the ninety-nine on the hills and go and look for the one that wandered away?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he happens to find it, truly I say to you that he rejoices over it more than over the ninety-nine that did not wander away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven that one of these little ones perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now if your brother sins against you, go correct him between you and him alone. If he listens to you, you have gained your brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he does not listen, take with you in addition one or two others, so that by the testimony of two or three witnesses every matter may be established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the church. But if he refuses to listen to the church also, let him be to you as a Gentile and a tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Truly I say to you, whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you release on earth will be released in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, truly I say to you that if two of you agree on earth about any matter that they ask, it will be done for them from my Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where two or three are gathered in my name, I am there in the midst of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter came up to him and said, “Lord, how many times will my brother sin against me and I will forgive him? Up to seven times?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “I do not say to you up to seven times, but up to seventy times seven!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For this reason the kingdom of heaven may be compared to a man—a king—who wanted to settle accounts with his slaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he began to settle them, someone was brought to him who owed ten thousand talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because he did not have enough to repay it, the master ordered him to be sold, and his wife and his children and everything that he had, and to be repaid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the slave threw himself to the ground and began to do obeisance to him, saying, ‘Be patient with me, and I will pay back everything to you!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the master of that slave, because he had compassion, released him and forgave him the loan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that slave went out and found one of his fellow slaves who owed him a hundred denarii, and taking hold of him, he began to choke him, saying, ‘Pay back everything that you owe!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his fellow slave threw himself to the ground and began to implore him, saying, ‘Be patient with me and I will repay you!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he did not want to, but rather he went and threw him into prison until he would repay what was owed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when his fellow slaves saw what had happened, they were extremely distressed, and went and reported to their master everything that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his master summoned him and said to him, ‘Wicked slave! I forgave you all that debt because you implored me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should you not also have shown mercy to your fellow slave as I also showed mercy to you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because he was angry, his master handed him over to the merciless jailers until he would repay everything that was owed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also my heavenly Father will do to you, unless each of you forgives his brother from your hearts!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that when Jesus had finished these statements, he went away from Galilee and came into the region of Judea on the other side of the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And large crowds followed him, and he healed them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharisees came up to him in order to test him, and asked if it was permitted for a man to divorce his wife for any cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said, “Have you not read that the one who created them from the beginning made them male and female
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, ‘On account of this a man will leave his father and his mother and will be joined to his wife, and the two will become one flesh’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, they are no longer two but one flesh. Therefore what God has joined together, man must not separate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Why then did Moses command us to give a document—a certificate of divorce—and to divorce her?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Moses, with reference to your hardness of heart, permitted you to divorce your wives, but from the beginning it was not like this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I say to you that whoever divorces his wife, except on the basis of sexual immorality, and marries another commits adultery, and whoever marries her who is divorced commits adultery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples said to him, “If this is the case of a man with his wife, it would be better not to marry!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “Not everyone can accept this saying but those to whom it has been given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there are eunuchs who were born as such from their mother’s womb, and there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by people, and there are eunuchs who have made themselves eunuchs for the sake of the kingdom of heaven. The one who is able to accept this, let him accept it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then children were brought to him so that he could lay his hands on them and pray, but the disciples rebuked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Allow the children, and do not forbid them to come to me, for to such belongs the kingdom of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he laid his hands on them and traveled on from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, someone came up to him and said, “Teacher, what good thing must I do so that I will have eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “Why are you asking me about what is good? There is one who is good. But if you want to enter into life, keep the commandments!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “Which ones?” And Jesus said, “Do not commit murder, do not commit adultery, do not steal, do not give false testimony,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: honor your father and your mother, and love your neighbor as yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young man said to him, “All these I have observed. What do I still lack?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “If you want to be perfect, go, sell your possessions and give the proceeds to the poor—and you will have treasure in heaven—and come, follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the young man heard the statement, he went away sorrowful, because he was one who had many possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to his disciples, “Truly I say to you that with difficulty a rich person will enter into the kingdom of heaven!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again I say to you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than a rich person into the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the disciples heard this, they were extremely amazed, saying, “Then who can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus looked at them and said to them, “With human beings this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter answered and said to him, “Behold, we have left everything and followed you. What then will there be for us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “Truly I say to you that in the renewal of the world, when the Son of Man sits on his glorious throne, you who have followed me—you also will sit on twelve thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or fields on account of my name will receive a hundred times as much, and will inherit eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many who are first will be last, and the last first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the kingdom of heaven is like a man—the master of the house—who went out early in the morning to hire workers for his vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after coming to an agreement with the workers for a denarius per day, he sent them into his vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And going out about the third hour, he saw others standing idle in the marketplace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to those people he said, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and I will give you whatever is right.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went. Going out again about the sixth and ninth hour he did the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And about the eleventh hour he went out and found others standing there and said to them, ‘Why are you standing here the whole day unemployed?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, ‘Because no one hired us.’ He said to them, ‘You go also into the vineyard.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when evening came, the owner of the vineyard said to his manager, ‘Call the workers and pay them their wages, beginning from the last up to the first.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the ones hired about the eleventh hour came, they received a denarius apiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the first came, they thought that they would receive more, and they also received a denarius apiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they received it, they began to complain against the master of the house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘These last people worked one hour and you made them equal to us who have endured the burden of the day and the burning heat!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered one of them and said, ‘Friend, I am not doing you wrong. Did you not come to an agreement with me for a denarius?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take what is yours and go! But I want to give to this last person the same as I gave to you also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it not permitted for me to do whatever I want with what is mine? Or is your eye evil because I am generous?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the last will be first and the first last.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples by themselves and said to them on the way,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and scribes, and they will condemn him to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will hand him over to the Gentiles to mock him and flog him and crucify him, and on the third day he will be raised.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came up to him with her sons, and kneeling down she asked something from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to her, “What do you want?” She said to him, “Say that these two sons of mine may sit one at your right hand and one at your left in your kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered and said, “You do not know what you are asking! Are you able to drink the cup that I am about to drink?” They said to him, “We are able.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You will indeed drink my cup, but to sit at my right hand and at my left is not mine to grant, but is for those for whom it has been prepared by my Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the ten heard this, they were indignant concerning the two brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus called them to himself and said, “You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and those in high positions exercise authority over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will not be like this among you! But whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whoever wants to be most prominent among you must be your slave—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were going out of Jericho, a large crowd followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there were two blind men sitting beside the road. When they heard that Jesus was passing by, they called out, saying, “Lord, have mercy on us, Son of David!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the crowd rebuked them so that they would be quiet. But they called out all the more, saying, “Lord, have mercy on us, Son of David!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus stopped, called them, and said, “What do you want me to do for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Lord, that our eyes be opened!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having compassion, Jesus touched their eyes, and immediately they received their sight and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they drew near to Jerusalem and came to Bethphage at the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying to them, “Go into the village before you, and right away you will find a donkey tied and a colt with her. Untie them and bring them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if anyone says anything to you, you will say, ‘The Lord needs them,’ and he will send them at once.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this took place so that what was spoken through the prophet would be fulfilled, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Say to the daughter of Zion,
    ‘Behold, your king is coming to you,
humble and mounted on a donkey,
    and on a colt, the foal of a pack animal.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the disciples went and did just as Jesus directed them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and brought the donkey and the colt and put their cloaks on them, and he sat on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a very large crowd spread their cloaks on the road, and others were cutting branches from the trees and spreading them on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the crowds who went ahead of him and the ones who followed were shouting, saying,
“Hosanna to the Son of David!
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!
    Hosanna in the highest heaven!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he entered into Jerusalem, the whole city was stirred up, saying, “Who is this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the crowds were saying, “This is the prophet Jesus from Nazareth of Galilee!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus entered the temple courts and drove out all those who were selling and buying in the temple, and overturned the tables of the money changers and the chairs of those who were selling doves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “It is written, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a cave of robbers!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the blind and the lame came up to him in the temple courts and he healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the wonderful things that he did, and the children shouting in the temple courts and saying, “Hosanna to the Son of David!” they were indignant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, “Do you hear what these children are saying?” So Jesus said to them, “Yes, have you never read, ‘Out of the mouths of children and nursing babies you have prepared for yourself praise’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And leaving them, he went outside of the city to Bethany and spent the night there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now early in the morning, as he was returning to the city, he was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seeing a single fig tree by the road, he went to it and found nothing on it except leaves only. And he said to it, “May there be no more fruit from you forever, and the fig tree withered at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they saw it, the disciples were astonished, saying, “How did the fig tree wither at once?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to them, “Truly I say to you, if you have faith and do not doubt, you will do not only what was done to the fig tree, but even if you say to this mountain, ‘Be lifted up and thrown into the sea,” it will happen!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever you ask in prayer, if you believe, you will receive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he arrived at the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came up to him while he was teaching, saying, “By what authority are you doing these things? And who gave you this authority?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to them, “I also will ask you one question. If you tell the answer to me, I also will tell you by what authority I am doing these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From where was the baptism of John—from heaven or from men?” And they began to discuss this among themselves, saying, “If we say ‘From heaven,’ he will say to us, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ we are afraid of the crowd, because they all look upon John as a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they answered and said to Jesus, “We do not know.” And he said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now what do you think? A man had two sons. He approached the first and said, ‘Son, go work in the vineyard today.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said, ‘I do not want to!’ But later he changed his mind and went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he approached the second and said the same thing. So he answered and said, ‘I will, sir,’ and he did not go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of the two did the will of his father?” They said, “The first.” Jesus said to them, “Truly I say to you that the tax collectors and the prostitutes are going ahead of you into the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John came to you in the way of righteousness and you did not believe him, but the tax collectors and the prostitutes did believe him. And when you saw it, you did not even change your minds later so as to believe in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen to another parable: There was a man—a master of a house—who planted a vineyard, and put a fence around it, and dug a winepress in it, and built a watchtower, and leased it to tenant farmers, and went on a journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the season of fruit drew near, he sent his slaves to the tenant farmers to collect his fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the tenant farmers seized his slaves, one of whom they beat, and one of whom they killed, and one of whom they stoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, he sent other slaves, more than the first ones, and they did the same thing to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So finally he sent his son to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the tenant farmers saw the son, they said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him and have his inheritance!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they seized him and threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the master of the vineyard arrives, what will he do to those tenant farmers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “He will destroy those evil men completely and lease the vineyard to other tenant farmers who will give him the fruits in their season.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to them, “Have you never read in the scriptures,
‘The stone which the builders rejected,
    this has become the cornerstone.
This came about from the Lord,
    and it is marvelous in our eyes’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason, I tell you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and will be given to a people who produce its fruits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, and the one on whom it falls—it will crush him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they knew that he was speaking about them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and although they wanted to arrest him, they were afraid of the crowds, because they looked upon him as a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And continuing, Jesus spoke to them again in parables, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The kingdom of heaven may be compared to a man—a king—who gave a wedding celebration for his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent his slaves to summon those who had been invited to the wedding celebration, and they did not want to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he sent other slaves, saying, ‘Tell those who have been invited, “Behold, I have prepared my dinner; my oxen and fattened cattle have been slaughtered, and everything is ready. Come to the wedding celebration!”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they paid no attention and went away—this one to his own field, that one to his business.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the others, seizing his slaves, mistreated them and killed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king was angry and sent his troops and destroyed those murderers and burned their city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to his slaves, ‘The wedding celebration is ready, but those who had been invited were not worthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, go out to the places where the roads exit the city and invite to the wedding celebration as many people as you find.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those slaves went out into the roads and gathered everyone whom they found, both evil and good, and the wedding celebration was filled with dinner guests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the king came in to see the dinner guests, he saw a man there not dressed in wedding clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, ‘Friend, how did you come in here, not having wedding clothes?’ But he could say nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king said to the servants, ‘Tie him up hand and foot and throw him into the outer darkness. In that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many are called but few are chosen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees went and consulted so that they could entrap him with a statement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they sent their disciples to him with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that you are truthful and teach the way of God in truth, and you do not care what anyone thinks, because you do not regard the opinion of people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore tell us what you think. Is it permitted to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because he knew their maliciousness, Jesus said, “Hypocrites! Why are you testing me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Show me the coin for the tax!” So they brought him a denarius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Whose image and inscription is this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Caesar’s.” Then he said to them, “Therefore give to Caesar the things of Caesar, and to God the things of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard this, they were astonished, and they left him and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day Sadducees—who say there is no resurrection—came up to him and asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Teacher, Moses said if someone dies without having children, his brother is to marry his wife and father descendants for his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were seven brothers with us. And the first died after getting married, and because he did not have descendants, he left his wife to his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also the second and the third, up to the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And last of all the woman died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the resurrection, therefore, whose wife of the seven will she be? For they all had her as wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered and said to them, “You are mistaken, because you do not know the scriptures or the power of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels of God in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning the resurrection of the dead, have you not read what was spoken to you by God, who said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob”? He is not the God of the dead, but of the living!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the crowds heard this, they were amazed at his teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Pharisees heard that he had silenced the Sadducees, they assembled at the same place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of them, a legal expert, put a question to him to test him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, which commandment is greatest in the law?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “‘You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the greatest and first commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the second is like it: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On these two commandments depend all the law and the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while the Pharisees were assembled, Jesus asked them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “What do you think about the Christ? Whose son is he?” They said to him, “David’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “How then does David, by the Spirit, call him ‘Lord,’ saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
    “Sit at my right hand
until I put your enemies
    under your feet”’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then David calls him ‘Lord,’ how is he his son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no one was able to answer him a word, nor did anyone dare from that day on to ask him any more questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus spoke to the crowds and to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “The scribes and the Pharisees sit on the seat of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore do and observe everything that they tell you, but do not do as they do, for they tell others to do something and do not do it themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they tie up heavy burdens and put them on people’s shoulders, but they themselves are not willing with their finger to move them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they do all their deeds in order to be seen by people, for they make their phylacteries broad and make their tassels long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they love the place of honor at banquets and the best seats in the synagogues
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the greetings in the marketplaces and to be called ‘Rabbi’ by people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are not to be called ‘Rabbi,’ because one is your teacher, and you are all brothers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And do not call anyone your father on earth, for one is your heavenly Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And do not be called teachers, because one is your teacher, the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the greatest among you will be your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But woe to you, scribes and Pharisees—hypocrites!—because you shut the kingdom of heaven before people! For you do not enter, nor permit those wanting to go in to enter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees—hypocrites!—because you travel around the sea and the dry land to make one convert, and when he becomes one, you make him twice as much a son of hell as you are!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, blind guides, who say, ‘Whoever swears by the temple, it is nothing! But whoever swears by the gold of the temple is bound by his oath.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fools and blind people! For which is greater, the gold or the temple that makes the gold holy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, ‘Whoever swears by the altar, it is nothing! But whoever swears by the gift that is on it is bound by his oath.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blind people! For which is greater, the gift or the altar that makes the gift holy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the one who swears by the altar swears by it and by everything that is on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one who swears by the temple swears by it and by the one who dwells in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one who swears by heaven swears by the throne of God and by the one who sits on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees—hypocrites!—because you pay a tenth of mint and dill and cumin, and neglect the more important matters of the law—justice and mercy and faithfulness! It was necessary to do these things while not neglecting those.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blind guides who filter out a gnat and swallow a camel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees—hypocrites!—because you cleanse the outside of the cup and the dish, but inside they are full of greed and self-indulgence!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup and the dish, so that the outside of it may become clean also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees—hypocrites!—because you are like whitewashed tombs which on the outside appear beautiful, but on the inside are full of the bones of the dead and of everything unclean!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, on the outside you also appear righteous to people, but inside you are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees—hypocrites!—because you build the tombs of the prophets and decorate the graves of the righteous,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partners with them in the blood of the prophets!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus you testify against yourselves that you are descendants of those who murdered the prophets!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you—fill up the measure of your fathers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Serpents! Offspring of vipers! How will you escape from the condemnation to hell?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason, behold, I am sending to you prophets and wise men and scribes. Some of them you will kill and crucify, and some of them you will flog in your synagogues and will pursue from town to town,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that upon you will come all the righteous blood shed on the earth from the blood of righteous Abel up to the blood of Zechariah son of Barachiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, all these things will come upon this generation!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, who kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to her! How many times I wanted to gather your children together the way a hen gathers her young together under her wings, and you were not willing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, your house has been left to you desolate!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I tell you, you will never see me from now on until you say,
‘Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Jesus went out of the temple courts he was going along, and his disciples came up to point out to him the buildings of the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said to them, “Do you not see all these things? Truly I say to you, not one stone will be left here on another stone that will not be thrown down!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was sitting on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came up to him privately, saying, “Tell us, when will these things happen, and what will be the sign of your coming and of the end of the age?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to them, “Watch out that no one deceives you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and they will deceive many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you are going to hear about wars and rumors of wars. See to it that you are not alarmed, for this must happen, but the end is not yet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nation will rise up against nation and kingdom against kingdom, and there will be famines and earthquakes in various places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all these things are the beginning of birth pains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then they will hand you over to persecution and will kill you, and you will be hated by all the nations because of my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then many will be led into sin and will betray one another and will hate one another,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and many false prophets will appear and will deceive many,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and because lawlessness will increase, the love of many will grow cold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who endures to the end—this person will be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this gospel of the kingdom will be proclaimed in the whole inhabited earth for a testimony to all the nations, and then the end will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So when you see the abomination of desolation spoken about by the prophet Daniel standing in the holy place” (let the one who reads understand),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “then those in Judea must flee to the mountains!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who is on his housetop must not come down to take things out of his house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the one who is in the field must not turn back to pick up his cloak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing their babies in those days!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But pray that your flight may not happen in winter or on a Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For at that time there will be great tribulation, such as has not happened from the beginning of the world until now, nor ever will happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And unless those days had been shortened, no human being would be saved. But for the sake of the elect, those days will be shortened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time if anyone should say to you, ‘Behold, here is the Christ,’ or ‘Here he is,’ do not believe him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For false messiahs and false prophets will appear, and will produce great signs and wonders in order to deceive, if possible, even the elect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have told you ahead of time!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore if they say to you, ‘Behold, he is in the wilderness,’ do not go out, or ‘Behold, he is in the inner rooms,’ do not believe it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as the lightning comes from the east and flashes to the west, so the coming of the Son of Man will be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever the corpse is, there the vultures will gather.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And immediately after the tribulation of those days,
‘the sun will be darkened
    and the moon will not give its light,
and the stars will fall from heaven,
    and the powers of heaven will be shaken.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in heaven, and then all the tribes of the earth will mourn, and they will see the Son of Man arriving on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will send out his angels with a loud trumpet call, and they will gather his elect together from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other end of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now learn the parable from the fig tree: Whenever its branch has already become tender and puts forth its leaves, you know that summer is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also you, when you see all these things, know that he is near, at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you that this generation will never pass away until all these things take place!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But concerning that day and hour no one knows—not even the angels of heaven nor the Son—except the Father alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as the days of Noah were, so the coming of the Son of Man will be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as in the days before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day Noah entered into the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did not know anything until the deluge came and swept them all away. So also the coming of the Son of Man will be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there will be two men in the field; one will be taken and one left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two women will be grinding at the mill; one will be taken and one left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore be on the alert, because you do not know what day your Lord is coming!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But understand this: that if the master of the house had known what watch of the night the thief was coming, he would have stayed awake and would not have let his house be broken into.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason you also must be ready, because the Son of Man is coming at an hour that you do not think he will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who then is the faithful and wise slave whom the master has put in charge of his household slaves to give them their food at the right time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is that slave whom his master will find so doing when he comes back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you that he will put him in charge of all his possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if that evil slave should say to himself, ‘My master is staying away for a long time,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he begins to beat his fellow slaves and eats and drinks with drunkards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the master of that slave will come on a day that he does not expect and at an hour that he does not know,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will cut him in two and assign his place with the hypocrites. In that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the kingdom of heaven may be compared to ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now five of them were foolish and five were wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when the foolish ones took their lamps, they did not take olive oil with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the wise ones took olive oil in flasks with their lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the bridegroom was delayed, they all became drowsy and fell asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in the middle of the night there was a shout, ‘Behold, the bridegroom! Come out to meet him!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all those virgins woke up and trimmed their lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the foolish ones said to the wise ones, ‘Give us some of your olive oil, because our lamps are going out!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the wise ones answered saying, “Certainly there will never be enough for us and for you! Go instead to those who sell olive oil and buy some for yourselves.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while they had gone away to buy it the bridegroom arrived, and those who were ready went inside with him to the wedding celebration, and the door was shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And later the other virgins came also, saying, ‘Lord, lord, open the door for us!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said, ‘Truly I say to you, I do not know you!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore be on the alert, because you do not know the day or the hour!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is like a man going on a journey. He summoned his own slaves and handed over his property to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to one he gave five talents, and to another two, and to another one, to each one according to his own ability, and he went on a journey immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who had received the five talents went out and traded with them and gained five more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way the one who had the two gained two more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who had received the one went away and dug up the ground and hid his master’s money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after a long time, the master of those slaves came and settled accounts with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one who had received the five talents came up and brought five more talents, saying, ‘Master, you handed over to me five talents. See, I have gained five more talents!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful slave! You were faithful over a few things; I will put you in charge over many things. Enter into the joy of your master!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one who had the two talents also came up and said, ‘Master, you handed over to me two talents. See, I have gained two talents more!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful slave! You were faithful over a few things; I will put you in charge over many things. Enter into the joy of your master!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one who had received the one talent came up also and said, ‘Master, because I knew you, that you are a hard man, reaping where you did not sow and gathering from where you did not scatter seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because I was afraid, I went away and hid your talent in the ground. See, you have what is yours!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his master answered and said to him, ‘Evil and lazy slave! You knew that I reap where I did not sow and gather from where I did not scatter seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you ought to have deposited my money with the bankers, and when I returned I would have gotten back what was mine with interest!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore take the talent from him and give it to the one who has the ten talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For to everyone who has, more will be given, and he will have an abundance. But from the one who does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And throw the worthless slave into the outer darkness—in that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Son of Man comes in his glory and all the angels with him, then he will sit on his glorious throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the nations will be gathered before him, and he will separate them from one another like a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will place the sheep on his right and the goats on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king will say to those on his right, ‘Come, you who are blessed by my Father. Inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink, I was a stranger and you welcomed me as a guest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was naked and you clothed me, I was sick and you cared for me, I was in prison and you came to me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the righteous will answer him, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you something to drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when did we see you a stranger and welcome you as a guest, or naked and clothe you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when did we see you sick or in prison and come to you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king will answer and say to them, ‘Truly I say to you, in as much as you did it to one of the least of these brothers of mine, you did it to me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he will also say to those on his left, ‘Depart from me, you accursed ones, into the eternal fire that has been prepared for the devil and his angels!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was hungry and you did not give me anything to eat, I was thirsty and you did not give me anything to drink,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was a stranger and you did not welcome me as a guest, naked and you did not clothe me, sick and in prison and you did not care for me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will also answer, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison and not serve you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he will answer them, saying, ‘Truly I say to you, in as much as you did not do it to one of the least of these, you did not do it to me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these will depart into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that when Jesus had finished all these sayings, he said to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You know that after two days the Passover takes place, and the Son of Man will be handed over in order to be crucified.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief priests and the elders of the people assembled in the palace of the high priest, who was named Caiaphas,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and plotted in order that they could arrest Jesus by stealth and kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were saying, “Not during the feast, so that there will not be an uproar among the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while Jesus was at Bethany in the house of Simon the leper,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a woman came up to him holding an alabaster flask of very expensive perfumed oil, and poured it out on his head while he was reclining at table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the disciples saw it they were indignant, saying, “Why this waste?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this could have been sold for a large sum and given to the poor!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, knowing this, said to them, “Why do you cause trouble for the woman? For she has done a good deed for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the poor you always have with you, but you do not always have me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when this woman poured this ointment on my body, she did it in order to prepare me for burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, wherever this gospel is proclaimed in the whole world, what this woman has done will also be told in memory of her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the twelve, the one named Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “What are you willing to give me if I in turn deliver him to you?” So they set out for him thirty silver coins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from that time on, he began seeking a favorable opportunity in order that he could betray him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the first day of the feast of Unleavened Bread the disciples came up to Jesus, saying, “Where do you want us to prepare for you to eat the Passover?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Go into the city to a certain man and tell him, ‘The Teacher says, “My time is near. I am celebrating the Passover with you with my disciples.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples did as Jesus directed them, and they prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was evening, he was reclining at table with the twelve disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they were eating he said, “Truly I say to you, that one of you will betray me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And greatly distressed, each one began to say to him, “Surely I am not he, am I, Lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said, “The one who dips his hand in the bowl with me—this one will betray me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man is going just as it is written about him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for him if that man had not been born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judas, the one who was betraying him, answered and said, “Surely I am not he, am I, Rabbi?” He said to him, “You have said it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while they were eating Jesus took bread and, after giving thanks, he broke it, and giving it to the disciples, he said, “Take, eat, this is my body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after taking the cup and giving thanks he gave it to them, saying, “Drink from it, all of you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for this is my blood of the covenant which is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you, from now on I will never drink of this fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new with you in the kingdom of my Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they had sung the hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus said to them, “You will all fall away because of me during this night, for it is written,
‘I will strike the shepherd
    and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after I am raised, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter answered and said to him, “If they all fall away because of you, I will never fall away!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Truly I say to you that during this night, before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to him, “Even if it is necessary for me to die with you, I will never deny you!” And all the disciples said the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went with them to a place called Gethsemane, and he said to the disciples, “Sit here while I go over there and pray.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And taking along Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, he began to be distressed and troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “My soul is deeply grieved, to the point of death. Remain here and stay awake with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And going forward a little he fell down on his face, praying and saying, “My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass from me. Nevertheless, not as I will, but as you will.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came to the disciples and found them sleeping, and he said to Peter, “So, were you not able to stay awake with me one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stay awake and pray that you will not enter into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again for the second time he went away and prayed, saying, “My Father, if this cannot pass unless I drink it, your will must be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came again and found them sleeping, for they could not keep their eyes open.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And leaving them again, he went away and prayed for the third time, saying the same thing again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came to the disciples and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Behold, the hour is near, and the Son of Man is being betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get up, let us go! Behold, the one who is betraying me is approaching!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while he was still speaking, behold, Judas—one of the twelve—arrived, and with him a large crowd with swords and clubs, from the chief priests and elders of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the one who was betraying him had given them a sign, saying, “The one whom I kiss—he is the one. Arrest him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came up to Jesus immediately and said, “Greetings, Rabbi,” and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Friend, do that for which you have come.” Then they came up and laid hands on Jesus and arrested him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, one of those with Jesus extended his hand and drew his sword, and striking the slave of the high priest, cut off his ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Put your sword back into its place! For all who take up the sword will die by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or do you think that I cannot call upon my Father, and he would put at my disposal at once more than twelve legions of angels?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How then would the scriptures be fulfilled that it must happen in this way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus said to the crowds, “Have you come out with swords and clubs, as against a robber, to arrest me? Every day in the temple courts I sat teaching, and you did not arrest me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all this has happened in order that the scriptures of the prophets would be fulfilled.” Then the disciples all abandoned him and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who had arrested Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders had gathered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter was following him from a distance, as far as the courtyard of the high priest. And he went inside and was sitting with the officers to see the outcome.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for false testimony against Jesus in order that they could put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did not find it, although many false witnesses came forward. And finally two came forward
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “This man said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and rebuild it within three days.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the high priest stood up and said to him, “Do you reply nothing? What are these people testifying against you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus was silent. And the high priest said to him, “I put you under oath by the living God, that you tell us if you are the Christ, the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “You have said it. But I tell you, from now on you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Power and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest tore his robes, saying, “He has blasphemed! What further need do we have of witnesses? Behold, you have just now heard the blasphemy!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What do you think?” And they answered and said, “He deserves death!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they spat in his face and struck him with their fists, and they slapped him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Prophesy for us, you Christ! Who is it who hit you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Peter was sitting outside in the courtyard, and a female slave came up to him and said, “You also were with Jesus the Galilean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it in the presence of them all, saying, “I do not know what you mean!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he went out to the gateway, another female slave saw him and said to those who were there, “This man was with Jesus the Nazarene.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he denied it with an oath, “I do not know the man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after a little while those who were standing there came up and said to Peter, “You really are one of them also, because even your accent reveals who you are.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began to curse and to swear with an oath, “I do not know the man!” And immediately a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter remembered the statement Jesus had said, “Before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times,” and he went outside and wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when it was early morning, all the chief priests and the elders of the people took counsel against Jesus in order to put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after tying him up, they led him away and handed him over to Pilate the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when Judas, the one who had betrayed him, saw that he had been condemned, he regretted what he had done and returned the thirty silver coins to the chief priests and elders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “I have sinned by betraying innocent blood!” But they said, “What is that to us? You see to it!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And throwing the silver coins into the temple he departed. And he went away and hanged himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief priests took the silver coins and said, “It is not permitted to put them into the temple treasury, because it is blood money.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after taking counsel, they purchased with them the Potter’s Field, for a burial place for strangers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For this reason that field has been called the Field of Blood until today.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then what was spoken by the prophet Jeremiah was fulfilled, who said, “And they took the thirty silver coins, the price of the one who had been priced, on whom a price had been set by the sons of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they gave them for the potter’s field, just as the Lord directed me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked him, saying, “Are you the king of the Jews?” And Jesus said, “You say so.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was being accused by the chief priests and elders he answered nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate said to him, “Do you not hear how many things they are testifying against you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he did not reply to him, not even with reference to one statement, so that the governor was very astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at each feast, the governor was accustomed to release one prisoner to the crowd—the one whom they wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at that time they had a notorious prisoner named Jesus Barabbas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after they had assembled, Pilate said to them, “Whom do you want me to release for you—Jesus Barabbas or Jesus who is called Christ?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For he knew that they had handed him over because of envy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent a message to him, saying, “Have nothing to do with that righteous man, for I have suffered much as a result of a dream today because of him.”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowds that they should ask for Barabbas and put Jesus to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the governor answered and said to them, “Which of the two do you want me to release for you?” And they said, “Barabbas!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to them, “What then should I do with Jesus, the one who is called Christ?” They all said, “Let him be crucified!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Why? What wrong has he done?” But they began to shout even louder, saying, “Let him be crucified!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate, when he saw that he was accomplishing nothing, but instead an uproar was developing, took water and washed his hands before the crowd, saying, “I am innocent of the blood of this man. You see to it!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people answered and said, “His blood be on us and on our children!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he released Barabbas for them, but after he had Jesus flogged, he handed him over so that he could be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the governor’s residence and gathered the whole cohort to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they stripped him and put a scarlet military cloak around him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and weaving a crown of thorns, they put it on his head, and put a reed in his right hand. And kneeling down before him, they mocked him, saying, “Hail, king of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they spat on him and took the reed and repeatedly struck him on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had mocked him, they stripped him of the military cloak and put his own clothes on him, and led him away in order to crucify him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were going out, they found a man of Cyrene named Simon. They forced this man to carry his cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came to a place called Golgotha (which means Place of a Skull),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they gave him wine mixed with gall to drink, and when he tasted it he did not want to drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had crucified him, they divided his clothes among themselves by casting lots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they sat down and were watching over him there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they put above his head the charge against him in writing: “This is Jesus, the king of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then two robbers were crucified with him, one on his right and one on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who passed by reviled him, shaking their heads
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “The one who would destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days, save yourself! If you are the Son of God, come down from the cross!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way also the chief priests, along with the scribes and elders, were mocking him, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He saved others; he is not able to save himself! He is the king of Israel! Let him come down now from the cross, and we will believe in him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He trusts in God; let him deliver him now if he wants to, because he said, ‘I am the Son of God’!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the same way even the robbers who were crucified with him were reviling him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now from the sixth hour, darkness came over all the land until the ninth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator
