verses.text: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Eli, Eli, lema sabachthani?” (that is, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of those who were standing there, when they heard it, said, “This man is summoning Elijah!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately one of them ran and took a sponge and filled it with sour wine and put it on a reed and gave it to him to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the others said, “Leave him alone! let us see if Elijah is coming to save him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus cried out again with a loud voice and gave up his spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, the curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom, and the earth shook and the rocks were split.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the tombs were opened, and many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and coming out of the tombs after his resurrection, they went into the holy city and appeared to many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the centurion and those with him who were guarding Jesus, when they saw the earthquake and the things that took place, were extremely frightened, saying, “Truly this man was God’s Son!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were many women there, observing from a distance, who had followed Jesus from Galilee, serving him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: among whom were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when it was evening, a rich man from Arimathea named Joseph came, who also was a disciple of Jesus himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man approached Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate ordered it to be given to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph took the body and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and placed it in his own new tomb that he had cut in the rock. And he rolled a large stone to the entrance of the tomb and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were there, sitting opposite the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the next day, which is after the day of preparation, the chief priests and the Pharisees assembled before Pilate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Sir, we remember that while that deceiver was still alive he said, ‘After three days I will rise.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore give orders that the tomb be made secure until the third day, lest his disciples come and steal him and tell the people, ‘He has been raised from the dead,’ and the last deception will be worse than the first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to them, “You have a guard of soldiers. Go, make it as secure as you know how.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went with the guard of soldiers and made the tomb secure by sealing the stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after the Sabbath, at the dawning on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to view the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a great earthquake, for an angel of the Lord descended from heaven and came up and rolled away the stone and sat down on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now his appearance was like lightning and his clothing white as snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the guards trembled from the fear of him and became like dead men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel answered and said to the women, “Do not be afraid, for I know that you are looking for Jesus, who was crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not here, for he has been raised, just as he said. Come, see the place where he was lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And go quickly, tell his disciples, ‘He has been raised from the dead, and behold, he is going ahead of you into Galilee. You will see him there.’ Behold, I have told you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, and ran to tell his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, Jesus met them, saying, “Greetings!” And they came up and took hold of his feet and worshiped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Do not be afraid! Go tell my brothers that they should go to Galilee, and there they will see me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they were going, behold, some of the guard of soldiers went into the city and reported to the chief priests everything that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they had assembled with the elders and had taken counsel, they gave a rather large sum of money to the soldiers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: telling them, “Say ‘His disciples came during the night and stole him while we were sleeping.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if this matter is heard before the governor, we will satisfy him and keep you out of trouble.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took the money and did as they were told, and spread abroad this report among the Jews until this very day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the eleven disciples proceeded to Galilee, to the mountain which Jesus had designated for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they saw him, they worshiped him, but some doubted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus approached and spoke to them, saying, “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, go and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: teaching them to observe everything I have commanded you, and behold, I am with you all the days until the end of the age.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
